tool.name: MapAlignerPoseClustering
tool.description: Corrects retention time distortions between maps using a pose clustering approach
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in_cond.in && #if $in_cond.in_select == "no" mkdir ${' '.join(["'in_cond.in/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_cond.in/%s/%s.%s' && " % (f, i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #else ln -s '$in_cond.in' 'in_cond.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cond.in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cond.in.ext)' && #end if #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out && mkdir ${' '.join(["'out/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} && #end if #if "trafo_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir trafo_out && mkdir ${' '.join(["'trafo_out/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} && #end if #if $reference.file: mkdir reference.file && ln -s '$reference.file' 'reference.file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $reference.file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($reference.file.ext)' && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in #if $in_cond.in_select == "no" ${' '.join(["'in_cond.in/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #else 'in_cond.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cond.in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cond.in.ext)' #end if #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out ${' '.join(["'out/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), f.ext) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #end if #if "trafo_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -trafo_out ${' '.join(["'trafo_out/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext("trafoxml")) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #end if #if $reference.file: -reference:file 'reference.file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $reference.file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($reference.file.ext)' #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing #if "trafo_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') ${' '.join(["&& mv -n 'trafo_out/%(bn)s/%(id)s.%(gext)s' 'trafo_out/%(bn)s/%(id)s'"%{"bn": i, "id": re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), "gext": $gxy2omsext("trafoxml")} for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in_select
param.label: Run tool in batch mode for -in
param.option: Yes: process each dataset in an independent job

param.label: Input files to align (all must have the same file type)
Input files to align (all must have the same file type)

section.name: reference
section.title: Options to define a reference file (use either 'file' or 'index', not both)

param.name: file
param.label: File to use as reference (same file format as input files required)

param.name: index
param.label: Use one of the input files as reference ('1' for the first file, etc.)
param.help: If '0', no explicit reference is set - the algorithm will select a reference

param.name: max_num_peaks_considered
param.label: The maximal number of peaks/features to be considered per map

param.name: mz_pair_max_distance
param.label: Maximum of m/z deviation of corresponding elements in different maps
param.help: This condition applies to the pairs considered in hashing

param.name: rt_pair_distance_fraction
param.label: Within each of the two maps, the pairs considered for pose clustering must be separated by at least this fraction of the total elution time interval

param.name: num_used_points
param.label: Maximum number of elements considered in each map (selected by intensity)
param.help: Use this to reduce the running time and to disregard weak signals during alignment. For using all points, set this to -1

param.name: scaling_bucket_size
param.label: The scaling of the retention time interval is being hashed into buckets of this size during pose clustering
param.help: A good choice for this would be a bit smaller than the error you would expect from repeated runs

param.name: shift_bucket_size
param.label: The shift at the lower (respectively, higher) end of the retention time interval is being hashed into buckets of this size during pose clustering
param.help: A good choice for this would be about the time between consecutive MS scans

param.name: max_shift
param.label: Maximal shift which is considered during histogramming (in seconds)

param.name: max_scaling
param.label: Maximal scaling which is considered during histogramming
param.help: The minimal scaling is the reciprocal of this

param.name: dump_buckets
param.label: [DEBUG] If non-empty, base filename where hash table buckets will be dumped to
param.help: A serial number for each invocation will be appended automatically

param.name: dump_pairs
param.label: [DEBUG] If non-empty, base filename where the individual hashed pairs will be dumped to (large!)
param.help: A serial number for each invocation will be appended automatically

param.name: second_nearest_gap
param.label: Only link features whose distance to the second nearest neighbors (for both sides) is larger by 'second_nearest_gap' than the distance between the matched pair itself

param.name: use_identifications
param.label: Never link features that are annotated with different peptides (features without ID's always match; only the best hit per peptide identification is considered)

param.name: ignore_charge
param.label: false [default]: pairing requires equal charge state (or at least one unknown charge '0'); true: Pairing irrespective of charge state

param.name: ignore_adduct
param.label: true [default]: pairing requires equal adducts (or at least one without adduct annotation); true: Pairing irrespective of adducts

section.name: distance_RT
section.title: Distance component based on RT differences

param.name: max_difference
param.label: Never pair features with a larger RT distance (in seconds)

param.name: exponent
param.label: Normalized RT differences ([0-1], relative to 'max_difference') are raised to this power (using 1 or 2 will be fast, everything else is REALLY slow)

param.name: weight
param.label: Final RT distances are weighted by this facto

section.name: distance_MZ
section.title: Distance component based on m/z differences

param.name: max_difference
param.label: Never pair features with larger m/z distance (unit defined by 'unit')

param.name: unit
param.label: Unit of the 'max_difference' paramete

param.name: exponent
param.label: Normalized ([0-1], relative to 'max_difference') m/z differences are raised to this power (using 1 or 2 will be fast, everything else is REALLY slow)

param.name: weight
param.label: Final m/z distances are weighted by this facto

section.name: distance_intensity
section.title: Distance component based on differences in relative intensity (usually relative to highest peak in the whole data set)

param.name: exponent
param.label: Differences in relative intensity ([0-1]) are raised to this power (using 1 or 2 will be fast, everything else is REALLY slow)

param.name: weight
param.label: Final intensity distances are weighted by this facto

param.name: log_transform
param.label: Log-transform intensities
param.help: If disabled, d = |int_f2 - int_f1| / int_max. If enabled, d = |log(int_f2 + 1) - log(int_f1 + 1)| / log(int_max + 1))

param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

collection.name: out
collection.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out
collection.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

collection.name: trafo_out
collection.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: trafo_out
collection.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "trafo_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Corrects retention time distortions between maps using a pose clustering approach.
For more information, visit https://openms.de/doxygen/release/3.1.0/html/TOPP_MapAlignerPoseClustering.html
